title: Aggregate Mutual Fund Flows and Reallocation Decisions Under Multimodal Uncertainty
affiliations: Université de Lorraine

detail.title: Aggregate Mutual Fund Flows and Reallocation Decisions Under Multimodal Uncertainty
detail.abstract: This study investigates how mutual fund flows, disaggregated into net flows, inflows, outflows, and excess flows, respond to multimodal uncertainty, encompassing political, climate, ESG, macroeconomic, and financial risks. Using a unique dataset of Luxembourg-domiciled funds from 2017 to 2024, we examine fund behavior across asset classes and fund sizes. Our findings reveal that financial market indicators, notably volatility and credit spreads, exert the strongest influence on fund flows, whereas climate and ESG uncertainties play a more limited role. In periods of heightened uncertainty, investors reallocate capital toward money market funds, consistent with flight-to-safety behavior. The analysis reveals differentiated behavioral responses depending on fund size, although climate and sustainability risks exert only a limited influence on overall fund dynamics. These results provide important implications for asset managers and regulators, underscoring the need to incorporate non-financial risks into portfolio construction and financial supervision amid rising environmental and geopolitical uncertainty.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了共同基金流量（包括净流量、流入、流出和超额流量）对多模态不确定性（如政治、气候、ESG、宏观经济和金融风险）的反应。研究发现，金融市场指标（如波动性和信用利差）对基金流量的影响最大，而气候和ESG不确定性的作用较小。投资者在不确定性加剧时倾向于将资金转向货币市场基金，表现出避险行为。
AI.research_question: 多模态不确定性如何影响共同基金流量的不同组成部分？
AI.motivation: 随着环境和地缘政治不确定性的增加，理解非金融风险对基金行为的影响对资产管理和监管具有重要意义。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于行为金融学和投资组合理论，研究多模态不确定性对投资者行为的影响。
AI.method: 使用2017年至2024年卢森堡注册基金的独特数据集，分析不同资产类别和基金规模的基金行为。
AI.findings: 金融市场指标（如波动性和信用利差）对基金流量的影响最强，气候和ESG不确定性的作用有限。投资者在不确定性加剧时转向货币市场基金。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了行为金融学中关于多模态不确定性对投资者行为影响的研究。

title: Dual Beliefs: Subjective Learning of Trading Talent
affiliations: Georgia Institute of Technology - Scheller College of Business

detail.title: Dual Beliefs: Subjective Learning of Trading Talent
detail.abstract: This paper studies how investors evaluate themselves and its implications. In my model, investors form subjective beliefs about both the stock currently held in portfolio and their trading talent and update their beliefs through learning with fading memory. I calibrate the memory decay parameters to account-level trading records and show that beliefs updating for talent is about 7 times more sensitive to return signals than that for the stock in portfolio. Consequently, the model predicts that stock replacing typically happens after a good performance of the existing stock, providing a dual learning perspective on the disposition effect. This framework also accounts for the widely documented performance-contingent trading intensity and investor attrition, which cannot be reconciled with the decreasing-gain property of the standard Bayesian learning.

AI.tldr: 本文研究投资者如何评估自己及其影响。模型显示，投资者通过带有衰减记忆的学习更新对持有股票和交易才能的主观信念，校准参数表明对才能的信念更新比对股票的敏感7倍。模型预测股票更换通常发生在现有股票表现良好后，为处置效应提供了双重学习视角。
AI.research_question: 投资者如何评估自己及其对交易行为的影响？
AI.motivation: 探讨投资者自我评估的机制及其对交易行为的实际影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 主观信念形成、衰减记忆学习、标准贝叶斯学习。
AI.method: 基于账户级交易记录校准记忆衰减参数的模型分析。
AI.findings: 对交易才能的信念更新比对股票的敏感7倍，股票更换通常发生在现有股票表现良好后。
AI.theory_contributions: 为处置效应提供了双重学习视角，扩展了标准贝叶斯学习的局限性。
AI.practical_contributions: 解释了绩效依赖的交易强度和投资者流失现象。

title: Improving Density Forecasts for Stock Prices: A Machine Learning Kernel Dressing Approach
affiliations: Feng Chia University and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: Improving Density Forecasts for Stock Prices: A Machine Learning Kernel Dressing Approach
detail.abstract: A novel framework for stock price density forecasting is proposed, integrating an ensemble forecasting system with affine kernel dressing. While ensemble forecasts have been widely adopted to improve accuracy and quantify uncertainty in weather prediction, their application to financial forecasting remains limited. This study addresses this gap by directly generating ensemble forecasts from stock price models and refining them through affine kernel dressing combined with analog-based parameter estimation. Empirically, we evaluate the predictive performance of the proposed model in comparison with a conventional benchmark. The results consistently demonstrate that the proposed model produces density forecasts more closely aligned with the true distribution of stock prices, significantly enhancing forecast accuracy. Robustness checks conducted across various ensemble sizes, performance metrics, and historical window lengths further confirm the model’s superior performance. These findings highlight the effectiveness and reliability of integrating analog-based kernel dressing within an ensemble framework for stock price density forecasting.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新的股票价格密度预测框架，结合了集成预测系统和仿射核修饰技术，显著提高了预测准确性。
AI.research_question: 如何通过集成预测和仿射核修饰技术改进股票价格密度预测的准确性？
AI.motivation: 尽管集成预测在气象预测中广泛应用以提高准确性和量化不确定性，但其在金融预测中的应用仍有限。本研究旨在填补这一空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 集成预测系统、仿射核修饰技术、类比参数估计。
AI.method: 直接从股票价格模型生成集成预测，并通过仿射核修饰和类比参数估计进行优化。
AI.findings: 提出的模型生成的密度预测更接近股票价格的真实分布，显著提高了预测准确性。
AI.theory_contributions: 为金融预测领域引入了集成预测和仿射核修饰技术的结合方法。
AI.practical_contributions: 提供了一种更准确的股票价格密度预测工具，对金融决策具有实际意义。

title: How Financial Influencers Rise: Performance Following and Social Transmission Bias
affiliations: Renmin University of China - School of Finance, Renmin University of China, Renmin University of China - School of Finance and Renmin University of China

detail.title: How Financial Influencers Rise: Performance Following and Social Transmission Bias
detail.abstract: Using unique account-level data from a leading Chinese fintech platform, we investigate how financial influencers, the key information intermediaries in social finance, attract followers through a process of social transmission bias. We document a robust performance-following pattern wherein retail investors overextrapolate influencers’ past returns rather than rational learning in the social network from their past performance. The transmission bias is amplified by two mechanisms: (1) influencers’ active social engagement and (2) their index fund-heavy portfolios. Evidence further reveals influencers’ self-enhancing reporting through selective performance disclosure. Crucially, the dynamics ultimately increase risk exposure and impair returns for follower investors.

AI.tldr: 本文通过中国领先金融科技平台的账户数据，研究了金融影响者如何通过社会传播偏见吸引追随者，发现投资者过度依赖影响者过去表现而非理性学习，导致风险增加和回报下降。
AI.research_question: 金融影响者如何通过社会传播偏见吸引追随者？
AI.motivation: 研究金融影响者作为社交金融中的关键信息中介，如何通过传播偏见影响投资者行为。
AI.theoretical_framework: 社会传播偏见、理性学习理论、行为金融学。
AI.method: 使用中国领先金融科技平台的独特账户级数据进行实证分析。
AI.findings: 投资者过度依赖影响者过去表现，传播偏见通过影响者的社交活动和指数基金组合放大，最终增加追随者风险并降低回报。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了社会传播偏见在金融社交网络中的作用机制。
AI.practical_contributions: 为投资者和监管机构提供了关于金融影响者行为及其潜在风险的实证依据。

title: Federal Reserve Communication and the COVID-19 Pandemic
affiliations: Bank of Israel, Stanford University and Bank of Israel - Research Department

detail.title: Federal Reserve Communication and the COVID-19 Pandemic

publicationDetails.detailsText: Manchester School, Wiley, vol. 93, issue 5, pages 464-484, September 2025 [10.1111/manc.12520]

detail.abstract: In this study, we examine the Federal Reserve’s communication strategies during the COVID-19 pandemic, comparing them with communication during previous periods of economic stress. Using specialized dictionaries tailored to COVID-19, unconventional monetary policy (UMP), and financial stability, combined with sentiment analysis and topic modeling techniques, we identify a distinct focus in Fed communication during the pandemic on financial stability, market volatility, social welfare, and UMP, characterized by notable contextual uncertainty. Through comparative analysis, we juxtapose the Fed’s communication during the COVID-19 crisis with its responses during the dot-com and global financial crises, examining content, sentiment, and timing dimensions. Our findings reveal that Fed communication and policy actions were more reactive to the COVID-19 crisis than to previous crises. Additionally, declining sentiment related to financial stability in interest rate announcements and minutes anticipated subsequent accommodative monetary policy decisions. We further document that communicating about UMP has become the “new normal” for the Fed’s Federal Open Market Committee meeting minutes and Chairman’s speeches since the Global Financial Crisis, reflecting an institutional adaptation in communication strategy following periods of economic distress. These findings contribute to our understanding of how central bank communication evolves during crises and how communication strategies adapt to exceptional economic circumstances.

AI.tldr: 本研究分析了美联储在COVID-19疫情期间的沟通策略，并与以往经济危机期间的沟通进行比较。研究发现，美联储在疫情期间更关注金融稳定、市场波动、社会福利和非传统货币政策，且沟通更具反应性。
AI.research_question: 美联储在COVID-19疫情期间的沟通策略与以往经济危机期间有何不同？
AI.motivation: 探讨央行沟通策略在经济危机中的演变及其对政策制定的影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 央行沟通理论、非传统货币政策理论、金融稳定理论。
AI.method: 使用COVID-19、非传统货币政策和金融稳定专用词典，结合情感分析和主题建模技术。
AI.findings: 美联储在COVID-19期间的沟通更具反应性，且金融稳定相关情绪的下降预示了宽松货币政策。非传统货币政策沟通已成为常态。

AI.practical_contributions: 为央行在经济危机中的沟通策略提供了实践指导。

title: Intellectual Property and Health Technological Innovations at the time of the Pandemic

detail.title: Intellectual Property and Health Technological Innovations at the time of the Pandemic

publicationDetails.detailsText: Law and Development Review, volume 18, issue 2, 2025[10.1515/ldr-2024-0009]

detail.abstract: Technological innovations at the time of the pandemic and post pandemic is the focus of this paper which examines the relationship between intellectual property (IP), artificial intelligence (AI) and the healthcare sector. Research in this area includes the rapidly growing artificial intelligence industries in the healthcare sector and the impact of intellectual property protection on emerging technologies. Taking an interdisciplinary and diverse perspective, this paper enriches the evolving scope of ethical discourse literature by focusing on intellectual property assets that use AI and regulation that shape the healthcare sector. Considering the gap between law and development theory and practice, this paper bridges academic knowledge in unpacking ethical and governance issues in the intellectual property industry, healthcare law and emerging technologies. Unpacking these issues is important in the law and development context as ethical issues that arise from emerging technologies using AI systems and the responses from policymakers in governing their developments create long-term implications to individuals and populations. Governance responses often vary according to the local contexts, and are dependent on the unique socio-cultural structures, institutional organisations and legal frameworks.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了疫情期间及后疫情时代技术创新，重点关注知识产权（IP）、人工智能（AI）与医疗行业的关联，分析了AI在医疗领域的快速发展及IP保护对新兴技术的影响。
AI.research_question: 疫情期间及后疫情时代，知识产权、人工智能与医疗行业之间的关系是什么？
AI.motivation: 研究旨在填补法律与发展理论及实践之间的空白，探讨AI技术在医疗领域中的伦理与治理问题。
AI.theoretical_framework: 结合跨学科视角，聚焦知识产权资产、AI技术及医疗行业法规，扩展伦理讨论的文献范围。
AI.method: 采用跨学科和多元视角，分析AI在医疗领域的应用及IP保护的影响。
AI.findings: 揭示了AI技术在医疗领域引发的伦理问题及政策制定者在治理中的不同应对方式，这些应对因地方背景而异。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了AI与知识产权伦理及治理的学术讨论，填补了法律与发展领域的理论空白。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了关于如何在不同社会文化和法律框架下治理AI技术的实践建议。

title: Islamic Finance as a Vehicle to Promote Improved Intellectual Property Rights in the Gulf Cooperation Council
affiliations: Coventry University

detail.title: Islamic Finance as a Vehicle to Promote Improved Intellectual Property Rights in the Gulf Cooperation Council
detail.abstract: The purpose of this article is to assess how Islamic finance can act as a vehicle to enhance the current intellectual property rights regime in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC). Islamic finance has developed within the constraints of sharia law and has been a growth sector for the GCC. This article will identify the main principles of Islamic finance that contribute to the success of Islamic finance, which can enhance intellectual property protection in the GCC. The main sharia-compliant areas to be considered are musharaka, mudaraba, murabaha, takaful, istisna, ijara, salam and sukuk. The article will outline the founding principles of Islamic finance, the governance of sharia boards, development of Islamic finance in the individual GCC states, different frameworks of sharia-compliant investment products and the impact of intellectual property rights on the varying Islamic finance investment tools. Furthermore, the article will discuss an integrated approach to intellectual property rights which learns les sons from the Islamic finance sector in relation to infrastructure, regulation and sharia compliance. The lessons learnt from Islamic finance will inform the overall framework of recommendations for an Islamic intellectual property model. The use of Islamic finance as a vehicle to promote better intellectual property rights in terms of defining a new intellectual property approach is novel. It is aimed at spearheading further research in this area, and it will form a part of the overall integrated approach proposals to intellectual property protection in the GCC and beyond.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了伊斯兰金融如何作为增强海湾合作委员会（GCC）知识产权保护的工具，分析了伊斯兰金融的核心原则及其对知识产权制度的潜在贡献。
AI.research_question: 伊斯兰金融如何作为工具增强GCC的知识产权保护制度？
AI.motivation: 伊斯兰金融在GCC地区发展迅速，其基于伊斯兰教法的原则可能为知识产权保护提供新思路。
AI.theoretical_framework: 伊斯兰金融的核心原则（如musharaka、mudaraba等）及其与知识产权保护的关联。
AI.method: 分析伊斯兰金融的原则、治理结构及其在GCC的发展，探讨其对知识产权保护的启示。
AI.findings: 伊斯兰金融的原则和治理模式可为知识产权保护提供新的框架和工具。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了基于伊斯兰金融原则的知识产权保护新理论框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为GCC及其他地区提供了整合伊斯兰金融与知识产权保护的实际建议。

title: Alpha In Indian Mutual Fund Returns
affiliations: Independent, Yale School of Management and Yale School of Management

detail.title: Alpha In Indian Mutual Fund Returns
detail.abstract: We investigate the performance of equity mutual funds in India by analyzing the returns of an aggregate portfolio constructed from 425 actively managed funds from January 2013 to December 2024. We first assess whether these funds generate positive alpha after accounting for both common factor exposures such as size, value, momentum, and profitability, and the management fees charged to investors. This analysis helps us distinguish between returns generated through systematic factor tilts and those arising from genuine managerial skill. We also test for performance persistence to understand if the outperformance (or underperformance) persists through the years or if it simply occurs by chance for our sample. We find that net returns for actively managed funds do not show a statistically significant positive alpha and that this outcome is persistent even for the largest and best-performing funds.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了印度股票型共同基金的表现，分析了2013年1月至2024年12月期间425只主动管理基金的回报。研究发现，扣除管理费和系统性风险因子后，这些基金未能产生显著的正超额收益，且表现持续性较差。
AI.research_question: 印度主动管理的股票型共同基金是否能产生显著的正超额收益？
AI.motivation: 探讨主动管理基金是否能够通过管理技能而非系统性风险因子获得超额收益，并验证其表现的持续性。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于资产定价模型（如多因子模型）和绩效持续性理论。
AI.method: 构建由425只主动管理基金组成的投资组合，分析其净回报，并控制规模、价值、动量和盈利能力等因子。
AI.findings: 主动管理基金的净回报未显示出显著的正超额收益，且表现持续性较差。
AI.theory_contributions: 为新兴市场（如印度）的基金绩效研究提供了实证证据，挑战了主动管理基金能够持续创造超额收益的观点。
AI.practical_contributions: 对投资者和基金管理公司提供了参考，表明主动管理基金可能无法持续提供超额回报，建议关注低成本被动投资策略。

title: Summoning Firms: Promoting Democratic Stability and Economic Prosperity in Times of Constitutional Crisis
affiliations: University of California, Los Angeles - School of Law

detail.title: Summoning Firms: Promoting Democratic Stability and Economic Prosperity in Times of Constitutional Crisis

declarations.ethicsApproval: n/a
declarations.funderStatement: n/a

detail.abstract:
Every day, members of the American business community are asking themselves what they can and should be doing to protect and preserve our democracy—consistent with their duties to their shareholders, directors, managers, and employees.  They’ve watched corporate leaders and entrepreneurs try to placate or even support anti-democratic saboteurs, only to realize that those most openly dismissive of civil rights and the rule of law are also hostile to free enterprise.  Not quite sure what to do—particularly if they fear the Democrats are more hostile to free enterprise—they have remained on the sidelines as economy-crushing campaigns targeting noncitizens, free trade, free press, public health and K-12 education, and universities gain momentum. 

The next phase of pressure and, seemingly, capitulation is already upon us, as firms are being coerced in a manner similar to how blue states, sanctuary cities, and universities are being threatened with investigations, sanctions, suffocating restrictions on autonomy, and fiscal impoundments.  Law firms and media giants are currently in the president’s crosshairs.  Meanwhile red state governors and activist lawyers are targeting all sorts of purportedly woke (but, in many cases, rather staid, conventionally run) businesses across myriad industries.  There is little reason to think that the White House or state attorneys general will stop at corporate law partnerships and elite media companies rather than widen their focus to sweep in banks, the tech giants, agricultural, and energy firms. 

By reminding the corporate sector of its responsibilities, obligations, and tremendous clout, by highlighting industry’s exposure and attendant legal and financial liabilities, and by appealing to executives’ and directors’ interest in innovation, expansion, and profit-maximization, this memo urges commitments to a “democracy dividend”—an investment in the future of American (and, by extension, global) liberal democracy that will pay off in the years and decades to come.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨美国商界在保护民主中的角色，分析其面临的挑战与责任，并提出“民主红利”作为解决方案。
AI.research_question: 美国商界如何在保护民主的同时履行对股东和员工的职责？
AI.motivation: 商界面临反民主势力的压力，同时担心民主党的政策对自由企业的敌意，导致其行动犹豫。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于企业社会责任与自由企业理论的结合。
AI.method: 通过分析当前政治经济环境，提出“民主红利”概念。
AI.findings: 商界需明确责任与影响力，投资民主以保障长期利益。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出“民主红利”作为企业社会责任的新视角。
AI.practical_contributions: 为企业提供在政治压力下保护民主的具体行动框架。

title: Employee Power and Audit Fees: Worldwide Evidence
affiliations: Marquette University - College of Business Administration, Hong Kong Polytechnic University - School of Accounting and Finance, Rochester Institute of Technology and Capital University of Economics and Business (CUEB) - International School of Economics and Management

detail.title: Employee Power and Audit Fees: Worldwide Evidence
detail.abstract: This paper investigates how country-level Employment Protection Legislation (EPL) affects auditors' pricing decisions. Using a sample of 22 OECD countries over the 1996-2011 period, we find that auditors charge lower fees for firms whose employees have greater collective bargaining power as a result of country-level employee protection legislation reforms. We further explore the potential channels and find that a firm's labor power is negatively associated with its earnings management and financial leverage, but positively associated with the value of employee stock options plans and staff wages. In addition, we find that the negative relationship between employee power and audit fees is more profound for firms headquartered in countries with weak corporate governance (i.e., common law countries, non-EU countries, worse governmental effectiveness), and for firms headquartered in countries with strong labor unions.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了国家层面的就业保护立法（EPL）如何影响审计师的定价决策。研究发现，由于EPL改革，员工集体谈判能力增强的企业支付的审计费用更低。
AI.research_question: 国家层面的就业保护立法（EPL）如何影响审计师的定价决策？
AI.motivation: 探讨EPL对审计费用的影响，揭示员工权力与企业财务行为及审计定价的关系。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于员工权力理论、公司治理理论和审计定价理论。
AI.method: 使用1996-2011年22个OECD国家的样本数据进行分析。
AI.findings: 员工权力越强，审计费用越低；员工权力与企业盈余管理和财务杠杆负相关，与员工股票期权计划和工资正相关。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了员工权力与审计定价关系的理论研究。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者和企业提供了关于EPL改革和审计费用管理的实践启示。

title: Market View
affiliations: Indiana University and Texas A&M University - Mays Business School - Finance Department

detail.title: Market View
detail.abstract: When investors disagree and trade on their views about asset returns, market prices reflect the wealth/consumption share weighted average belief about risk premia, where more accurate, risk tolerant, or patient investors carry a larger weight. We explore the properties of this market view, and show that many puzzling properties of survey measures can be reconciled within disagreement models. For instance, a model with disagreement about output growth matches the negative correlation between statistical and survey-based measures of the risk premium, the higher variance and lower persistence of statistical measures of the risk premium and the appearance of return extrapolation.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了投资者意见分歧对市场价格的影响，发现市场价格反映了投资者对风险溢价的财富/消费份额加权平均信念。研究表明，许多调查指标的矛盾特性可以通过意见分歧模型解释。
AI.research_question: 投资者意见分歧如何影响市场价格，并解释调查指标中的矛盾现象？

title: Essays on the Impact of Economic Freedom, Climate Change, and Household Decision-Making on Women's Well-Being
affiliations: Flinders University - College of Business Government and Law

detail.title: Essays on the Impact of Economic Freedom, Climate Change, and Household Decision-Making on Women's Well-Being

publicationDetails.detailsText: Flinders University, College of Business, Government and Law; 2025

detail.abstract:
This thesis examines the complex connections between and the impact of economic freedom, climate change, and household decision-making (HDM) on gender dynamics and women's well-being within development economics. Divided into three main studies the thesis examines the worldwide issues concerning countries from both macroeconomic and microeconomic perspectives. 

The first study examines the empirical link between economic freedom and fertility rates using panel data from developed and developing nations. Our fixed effects instrumental variable (IV) analysis shows global evidence of a negative impact of economic freedom on fertility behaviour. The influence is particularly pronounced in industrialised and high-income nations than in developing countries. Additionally, our instrumental variable quantile regression analysis reveals a more substantial negative effect for countries with a higher fertility rate. Lastly, we show that the negative impact operates through multiple channels, including income level, women's unemployment, and their decision to receive tertiary education. 

The second study examines the associations between climate change indicators and legal gender disparity for a global group of developed and developing nations. Our results show that temperature shocks have a pervasive detrimental influence on gender equality. We link deviations from average temperatures to decreases in gender equality rights. This set of influences is more prevalent in developing than developed ones. We argue that less advanced stages of economic development, more reliance on agriculture, higher maternal mortality, and lower levels of democracy are potential mechanisms through which climate change affects gender equality. Policies to improve women's rights and adapt to climate change may be necessary to prioritise and provide greater attention to these crucial intermediate channels.

The third study focuses on the relationship between women's participation in decision-making and emotional intimate partner violence (IPV) using cross-sectional data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) encompassing nearly one million women across 50 developing countries. Our analyses, including OLS, 2SLS, and Bivariate probit, reveal a significant negative impact of women's decision-making on emotional IPV, particularly pronounced in Sub-Saharan Africa, South Asia, and Southeast Asia. Heterogeneity analysis indicates that increased decision-making authority notably reduces specific forms of emotional abuse, such as humiliation, threats, and insults. The protective effect is strongest among women aged 30-34, with diminishing effects in older age groups. Furthermore, this impact is more substantial in wealthier households, women whose husbands have completed secondary education or higher, and those currently employed. Conversely, the protective effects are less significant in poorer households. Collaborative decision-making across various domains is crucial for reducing emotional violence between partners and fostering equality and mutual respect.

The aim of the thesis is to comprehend how the elements revealed in each of these three studies intersect and shape broader development outcomes.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了经济自由、气候变化与家庭决策对性别动态和女性福祉的复杂影响，通过三个研究从宏观和微观角度分析了全球问题。

title: Retail Access to Private Markets
affiliations: Harvard University - Harvard Law School

detail.title: Retail Access to Private Markets
detail.abstract:
In recent years, asset managers have launched dozens of products that provide ordinary investors with access to private market investments. Sponsors are promoting these funds as a way to "democratize" private markets and give everyday savers an unprecedented opportunity to diversify their portfolios and earn attractive risk-adjusted returns. However, the funds combine features of private funds and mutual funds in ways that create unique risks for investors. 

In this paper, I explore the rise of these new "retail private funds" and the accompanying risks to investors. I study these funds' legal structures and analyze data collected from their public filings. First, I present evidence that the new funds, like private funds, report very low return volatility that understates their risk. However, because the new funds admit less sophisticated investors and provide periodic liquidity at their reported net asset values, the underreported volatility presents greater investor protection concerns than in private funds. Second, I provide suggestive evidence that some products that are restricted to wealthier investors perform better than products sold more broadly. This performance gap raises the possibility that sponsors are channeling products with poor performance to investors with low financial sophistication and little wealth. 

I conclude by discussing legal and policy changes that would give retail investors the tools they need to avoid being taken advantage of as they invest in the new funds. As policymakers continue to consider ways to expand access to private markets, they should grapple with the risks I highlight and plan ways to mitigate them.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了新型“零售私募基金”的兴起及其对投资者的独特风险，分析了其法律结构和公开数据，揭示了低波动性报告和高净值投资者表现优势的问题，并提出了政策建议。
AI.research_question: 新型零售私募基金的兴起如何影响普通投资者，并带来哪些独特风险？
AI.motivation: 近年来，资产管理公司推出了一系列让普通投资者参与私募市场的产品，但这些产品结合了私募基金和共同基金的特点，可能对投资者构成独特风险。
AI.theoretical_framework: 本文基于投资者保护理论和行为金融学，分析了零售私募基金的风险特征。
AI.method: 通过分析公开文件中的数据，研究零售私募基金的法律结构和表现。
AI.findings: 研究发现，这些基金报告的波动性较低，但实际风险被低估；同时，高净值投资者的产品表现优于广泛销售的产品。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了零售私募基金在投资者保护和风险披露方面的理论缺陷。
AI.practical_contributions: 提出了法律和政策建议，帮助零售投资者避免在投资新型基金时被利用。

title: Shifting Paradigms in Bank-Firm Relationships: Post-GFC Dynamics in the Syndicated Loan Market
affiliations: Monash Business School - Department of Banking and Finance, Monash University, Monash University and Monash University - Department of Banking and Finance

detail.title: Shifting Paradigms in Bank-Firm Relationships: Post-GFC Dynamics in the Syndicated Loan Market

declarations.funderStatement: This research was partially funded by the Australian Research Council through Discovery Grant DP190100606, and we appreciate their support.

detail.abstract: This paper examines post-Global Financial Crisis (GFC) changes in the relevance of bank capitalization and bank-dependent borrowers in determining bank-firm matching in the U.S. syndicated loan market. Since 2010, the bond market's expansion and low interest rates have weakened traditional ties between unrated firms and well-capitalized banks. Better bond market access reduces unrated firms' reliance on well-capitalized banks, while lower-capitalized banks seek higher yields by lending to these firms. These shifts reflects how alternative financing channels, monetary policy and regulatory changes have reshaped lending relationships post-GFC. During the COVID-19 crisis, matching with well-capitalized banks did not improve unrated firms' access to credit. This result indicates that post-GFC capital regulations and stress testing frameworks improved the solvency of low-capital banks, thereby mitigating the impact of disrupted matching during COVID-19.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了全球金融危机后，银行资本化和依赖银行的借款人在美国银团贷款市场中如何影响银行与企业的匹配关系。研究发现，债券市场的扩张和低利率削弱了无评级企业与资本充足银行之间的传统联系。
AI.research_question: 全球金融危机后，银行资本化和依赖银行的借款人在美国银团贷款市场中如何影响银行与企业的匹配关系？
AI.motivation: 研究动机是探索金融危机后金融市场变化（如债券市场扩张和低利率）如何重塑银行与企业的借贷关系。

declarations.funderStatement: We thank the European Union for financially supporting this research through Sindh Union Council and Community Strengthening Support (SUCCESS) program under grant contract – External Actions of the European Union – DCI-ASIE/2015/364-599

detail.abstract: We study the impact of a unique community-driven development (CDD) program designed for, run and led by women on empowerment. Our intervention combines social mobilization and support packages for poor households. We randomized the treatment across 23 clusters of settlements and sampled 2298 households from 150 settlements. We find indication that the intervention increased information about local government for the whole sample and strong evidence for strengthened perceptions about political participation, as well as access to public goods for women who assume a leadership role. We find no significant effects on intrahousehold decision-making, household's economic well-being, and social cohesion.

title: A Meta-Review and Redefinition of the Social Acceptability and Acceptance Concepts for Natural Resource Management, And Their Application in Ecological Restoration
affiliations: Université Laval and Université Laval

detail.title: A Meta-Review and Redefinition of the Social Acceptability and Acceptance Concepts for Natural Resource Management, And Their Application in Ecological Restoration

declarations.funderStatement: The research was funded by the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada that funded the project through an Alliance Society grant (ALLRP 586467 – 23) as part of the RARE project: Recherche et application pour une restauration éclairée des milieux humides, Université Laval.

detail.abstract: • The notions of social acceptability and acceptance (SAA) have become unavoidable in natural resource management and restoration projects, and their origin is grounded in multiple fields of knowledge pertaining to management. • The lack of widely accepted theory, definition or comprehensive typology of factors influencing SAA limits further formalization of analytical tools based on this notion. Hence, SAA has mostly been used through an instrumental approach in the industry (e.g. social license to operate). • The most complete definition of SAA comes from Busse & Siebert (2018) and considers social acceptance to be the positive result of a personal or collective acceptability judgment that can also result in non-acceptance of a given project or policy. • Relevant dimensions described for SAA are community acceptance-the most widespread dimension in the literature on natural resource management-socio-political acceptance and market acceptance, and these can be both positively and negatively correlated with each other. Market acceptance differs from the other dimensions in that it is expressed through engagement. • SAA can vary throughout the phases of a project or policy, which can be defined as input (before implementation), throughput (during implementation) and output (after implementation). • Factors influencing SAA are the focus of most publications but are highly contextual, hence establishing a complete list may not be useful. However, general categories of factors can be derived from the literature: o Personal constructs, social constructs, and behavioral factors: it is through perceptions and representations that individuals and communities evaluate projects and policies to form an acceptability judgement (through personal beliefs, opinions, preferences) that will be expressed through attitudes and behaviours. Socio-psychological needs of procedural justice, self-determination, security and recognition might be of high relevance to understand acceptability judgements. o Context: individual, social, cultural, political, economic and environmental factors within multiple scales, levels, spaces and times, all contribute to changing perceptions and attitudes. Governance arrangements are of especially high relevance, with bottom-up arrangements being usually granted higher acceptance. Social and ecological outcomes: defined as the positive or negative, intentional or unintentional change that may be brought about by a project or policy, may they be anticipated, perceived or observed. o Relational factors: core factors of influence for SAA. They include 1) legitimacy and credibility of projects and project promoters; 2) distributive justice, referring to equality or fairness of the distribution of outcomes (costs or benefits) of a given project, and procedural justice, referring to the perceived fairness of decision-making processes where multi-actor engagement is usually perceived as fairer, and 3) individual or community trust in project promoters, which, if established, can override all other factors. • SAA in ecological restoration is highly contextual, raising issues of fair and democratic participation among communities targeted by projects, along with trust and legitimacy.

AI.tldr: 社会可接受性与接受度（SAA）在自然资源管理和恢复项目中至关重要，但缺乏统一的理论和定义。其影响因素多样且高度情境化，包括个人与社会建构、背景因素、社会生态结果及关系因素。
AI.research_question: 社会可接受性与接受度（SAA）在自然资源管理和恢复项目中的理论框架及其影响因素是什么？
AI.motivation: SAA在自然资源管理中日益重要，但缺乏统一的理论和定义，限制了其分析工具的发展。
AI.theoretical_framework: Busse & Siebert（2018）的SAA定义及其三个维度：社区接受度、社会政治接受度和市场接受度。
AI.method: 文献综述，分析SAA的定义、维度及影响因素。
AI.findings: SAA的影响因素包括个人与社会建构、背景、社会生态结果及关系因素，且高度情境化。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了SAA的多维度框架及其动态性，填补了理论空白。
AI.practical_contributions: 为自然资源管理和恢复项目提供了SAA评估的实践指导，强调公平参与和信任的重要性。

detail.title: Flood Risk and Flood Insurance

publicationDetails.journalName: Federal Reserve Bank of New York Research Paper Series

detail.abstract:
Recent natural disasters have renewed concerns about insurance markets for natural disaster relief. In January 2025, wildfires wreaked havoc in residential areas outside of Los Angeles. Direct damage estimates for the Los Angeles wildfires range from $76 billion to $131 billion, with only up to $45 billion of insured losses (Li and Yu, 2025). In this post, we examine the state of another disaster insurance market: the flood insurance market. We review features of flood insurance mandates, flood insurance take-up, and connect this to work in a related Staff Report that explores how mortgage lenders manage their exposure to flood risk. Mortgages are a transmission channel for monetary policy and also an important financial product for both banks and nonbank lenders that actively participate in the mortgage market. 

To view post: https://libertystreeteconomics.newyorkfed.org/2025/08/flood-risk-and-flood-insurance/

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The authors declare that there are no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper titled “Effect of Corporate Governance on Earnings Management in Nigeria: Evidence from Listed Manufacturing Firms,” published in Educational Administration: Theory and Practice. All authors affirm that the research was conducted independently, and no external financial support, sponsorship, or commercial interest had any influence on the study design, data analysis, interpretation of results, or writing of the manuscript.

detail.abstract: This study investigates the impact of corporate governance on the earning management of the listed manufacturing firms in Nigeria utilizing annual time series data covering the duration of 2013 to 2023. The data was derived from 36 selected listed manufacturing firms in Nigeria, and the panel autoregressive distributed lag model (ARDL) was used as the standard model. In addition, the generalized method of moment (GMM) was used as the model for the robustness check model. The earning management was measured with distortionary accruals. In contrast, corporate governance was measured with indicators such as the board size, board governance, and remuneration committees, the number of meetings held by the board, the number of stockholder committees, the number of remuneration committees, and the number of audit committees, and checked their effects on the earning management of the listed manufacturing firms in Nigeria. Findings from the result of the ARDL estimation show that corporate governance has important positive effects on the earning management of listed manufacturing firms in Nigeria. Similarly, we also found that corporate governance has significant positive effects on the earning management of listed manufacturing firms in Nigeria based on the results of the GMM robustness checks. Finally, this study found that corporate governance has a significant positive impact on the earnings management of the listed manufacturing firms in Nigeria. Established the study findings, this study advises that authorities should seek to make policies that would boost corporate governance and minimize earning management in Nigeria.

detail.title: Exploring Court Culture and its Scale Development
detail.abstract: I conducted three interlocking studies to explore the concept of court culture and to develop a court culture scale. In study 1, I conducted in-depth interviews of legal professionals and clients (n=51) from the Indian states of Uttar Pradesh (UP) and Uttarakhand (UK) to identify the indicators of court culture. In study 2, I generated the items and refined them. In study 3, I surveyed legal professionals to assess measurement dimensionality and reliability (n=517). The scale indicated seven independent court culture dimensions: outcome orientation, manipulation, discipline, individualism & collectivism, work orientation, pride, and professionalism.

title: Deconstructing Market Resilience: Evidence from a Quantile Analysis of Loss Aversion and Macroeconomic Variables
affiliations: ISCAE Business School

detail.title: Deconstructing Market Resilience: Evidence from a Quantile Analysis of Loss Aversion and Macroeconomic Variables
detail.abstract:
E mail : Amira.berrahal8@gmail.com

Abstract
While market resilience is a cornerstone of financial stability, its behavioral underpinnings remain insufficiently explored. This study bridges that gap by investigating the dual impact of investor loss aversion—a key behavioral bias—and key macroeconomic variables on the resilience of the Tunisian stock market. Employing a quantile regression on panel data for firms listed on the Tunis Stock Exchange (BVMT) from 2020 to 2023, we analyze these effects across different states of market efficiency. Our analysis reveals two primary findings. First, loss aversion exerts a significant and pervasively negative influence on market resilience across all market conditions. Second, the impact of macroeconomic factors is state-dependent: inflation's negative effect is concentrated in the most efficient market states, while higher interest rates are positively associated with resilience, but only within these same high-efficiency quantiles. These results underscore the necessity of integrating behavioral finance into models of market stability and demonstrate that the relationship between macroeconomic policy and resilience is highly contextual, thus providing a more granular understanding of its determinants in an emerging economy.
Keywords: Resilience, Behavioral Finance, Loss Aversion, Macroeconomic Variables, Quantile Regression, Emerging Markets

title: National Security and Farmland Ownership: Livin' AFIDA Loca
affiliations: Drake University - Law School

detail.title: National Security and Farmland Ownership: Livin' AFIDA Loca

keywords: CFIUS Scope of Authority: Covered Real Estate Transactions 2. CFIUS & Agriculture B. USDA's Role: AFIDA 1. AFIDA: Scope & Reporting Requirements 2. AFIDA: Key Terms 3. AFIDA: Data Analysis & Reporting Requirements C. AFIDA & CFIUS: Ineffective

detail.abstract: The brutal history of conflict over land demonstrates its importance for national security. Farmland in particular is in short supply and has appropriately been designated as "critical infrastructure." However, the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) reviews foreign investment in farmland only if the farmland's location is close to military or other sensitive sites. The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) gathers information on specific types of foreign farmland investment yet is wholly removed from any type of national security review. While it might seem like a ban on foreign investment in farmland is an easy solution to this problem, that is far from true. The first in a planned series of articles looking at threats to farmland, this article argues that farmland-central to America's food supply, natural resources, and international relations-must be treated as critical infrastructure subject to review under the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) even if it is not located near a military or other sensitive site. Specifically, "covered real estate transactions" should be redefined to include foreign farmland investments meeting strategic criteria such as that already existing with USDA reporting regulations and various state reporting laws.

AI.tldr: 本文主张将美国农田视为关键基础设施，即使其不靠近军事或敏感地点，也应纳入CFIUS审查范围。

AI.motivation: 农田对国家粮食供应、自然资源和国际关系至关重要，但现有政策仅审查靠近敏感地点的农田投资，存在安全漏洞。
AI.theoretical_framework: 关键基础设施理论、国家安全政策框架。
AI.method: 政策分析与建议，结合现有法规（如USDA报告法规和州法律）提出战略标准。
AI.findings: 现有政策未能全面覆盖农田投资的潜在威胁，需重新定义“覆盖房地产交易”以纳入战略农田投资。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了关键基础设施理论在农田保护中的应用。
AI.practical_contributions: 提出政策建议，以增强农田投资的审查机制，保障国家安全。

detail.title: Exploring Indicators of Court performance in Subordinate Courts
detail.abstract: This study has explored the indicators of court performance by using literature review and in-depth interviews of legal professionals (n=36) and clients (n=15) from the district courts of Indian states of Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand. This study has identified two types of indicators of court performance, qualitative and quantitative indicators. Qualitative indicators include court performance indicators such as access to justice, quality of judicial decisions, equality, fairness, integrity, independence, accountability, and public trust, whereas quantitative indicators such as case clearance rate, judges per million population, etc. These indicators can be used to develop a scale for measuring court performance.

AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了司法绩效评估的理论框架，提出了综合定性与定量指标的方法。

detail.title: CONSTITUTIONAL ANALYSIS OF THE COLOMBIAN ECONOMIC REGIME IN TERMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS Economic Regime and Human Rights
detail.abstract: This paper critically analyzes Title XII of the Colombian Constitution (1991-2025), which addresses the economic regime and public finances, based on the sociological theory of Émile Durkheim and the philosophy of legal positivism. It examines the normative coherence between the constitutional articles and the principles of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, as well as their degree of relevance to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The approach integrates economic, territorial, and cultural dimensions, assessing their impact on tax equity and collective well-being.

AI.tldr: 本文基于涂尔干的社会学理论和法律实证主义哲学，批判性分析了哥伦比亚宪法（1991-2025）第十二章关于经济制度和公共财政的内容，探讨了宪法条款与《世界人权宣言》原则的规范性一致性及其对可持续发展目标（SDGs）的相关性。
AI.research_question: 哥伦比亚宪法第十二章的经济制度和公共财政条款如何与《世界人权宣言》原则及可持续发展目标（SDGs）相协调？
AI.motivation: 研究旨在评估宪法条款的规范性一致性及其对社会经济公平和集体福祉的实际影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 涂尔干的社会学理论和法律实证主义哲学。
AI.method: 整合经济、领土和文化维度，分析宪法条款的规范性一致性和实际影响。
AI.findings: 宪法条款与《世界人权宣言》原则有一定一致性，但对可持续发展目标的实现程度仍需进一步评估。

detail.abstract: Skip to main content Home About Contact Content Advertising Become a member of IACA Search… Account Homepage image Society Logo Journal Name Logo International Journal for Court Administration Start Submission Become a Reviewer Reading: Exploring Court Performance and Developing its Scale Download Alt. Display Exploring Court Performance and Developing its Scale Academic Articles Authors Dinesh Kumar Ram Manohar Singh Abstract Courts are an important part of the judiciary. To reduce the pendency of cases, measuring and improving court performance is important. With the objectives of exploring court performance and developing its scale, we conducted two interlocking studies. In study 1, we explored it conceptually. We identified the indicators of court performance through in-depth interviews of legal professionals and clients from the district courts of the Indian states of Uttar Pradesh (UP) and Uttarakhand (UK) (n = 51). Interviews were analysed using thematic analysis. Based on interviews, we generated items and refined them by using a pilot study (n = 105). After that, in Study 2, we surveyed court stakeholders to assess measurement dimensionality and reliability (n = 517). The scale’s dimensionality was tested using exploratory factor analysis and reliability was tested using Cronbach’s alpha scores. The scale indicated three dimensions: quality of judicial activity, access to justice, and public trust, and excellent internal consistency reliability (α = .959). This scale can be used to measure court performance by taking responses from legal professionals.

detail.abstract: Although part-time work can provide important accommodations and yexibility for people with disabilities, the rise of contingent labor has left many of these workers in lower-paid jobs that are often associated with manual labor or routine service work. Why do people with disabilities work part-time? What are the benefts and drawbacks of parttime work, and do these vary across occupations? Using data from the 2013-2019 French Labor Force Survey (N = 122,033), we fnd that people with disabilities are more likely to work part-time across occupations, citing health reasons or the lack of full-time work opportunities. These higher rates of part-time work contribute to disabilityrelated earnings gaps, but even among part-time workers, people with disabilities earn less than those without disabilities and experience wage penalties that can vary across occupations. By focusing on the reasons for part-time work and its ejects across occupational groups, our analysis highlights structural factors-beyond disability statusthat shape employment outcomes and are not fully addressed by equal pay policies for part-and full-time workers.

affiliations: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), Imperial College London and European Central Bank (ECB)

detail.title: Bank Lending Implications of Climate Stress Tests
detail.abstract: Do climate stress tests affect bank credit supply to brown firms? Using a difference-in-differences approach and detailed data on individual bank loans in the euro area, this paper provides novel evidence on the effects of the ECB’s 2022 climate risk stress test. Despite no capital implications or public disclosures, participating banks significantly reduced credit to greenhouse gas-intensive industries relative to nonparticipants. Among affected firms, smaller borrowers were more negatively impacted. Notably, only the best-performing banks in the climate stress test significantly reduce their brown credit after participation. This is evidence that banks which are more advanced in climate risk management more proactively consider transition risks in their lending. In contrast, banks less advanced in managing climate risk do not to the same extent discriminate against polluting firms.

title: Exploring the roles and challenges of national development experts on the Rohingya crisis in Bangladesh
affiliations: Department of Political Science and Sociology, North South University and University of South Wales

detail.title: Exploring the roles and challenges of national development experts on the Rohingya crisis in Bangladesh
detail.abstract: Bangladesh hosts nearly one million Rohingyas who live in several congested camps in Cox's Bazar, making it the largest refugee camp in the world. Many NGOs and several UN agencies support the Rohingyas with essential basic needs. The enormity and complex nature of the crisis have created spaces for practitioners, researchers, academics, and activists to get involved in the quest for a dignified and sustainable solution for the Rohingyas. Based on 25 interviews with various "experts" (including academics, researchers, and activists) working on the Rohingya crisis, this paper explores to what extent the "experts" can play a meaningful role in resolving this crisis. Our evidence suggests that a nonchalant, non-responsive practice limits the roles of "experts" in making meaningful contributions towards effective policy formulation for this crisis. Traditionally, there remains a lack of evidence-based policy formation in various sectors in Bangladesh. The case of the Rohingya is no exception. The lack of evidence-based policy culture makes it difficult for the experts, although "international": experts enjoy some advantages over national experts.

title: One Size Does Not Fit All: Unveiling Asymmetric Transmission of Monetary Policy in the Euro Area
affiliations: Yonsei University, University of Virginia - Department of Economics and Yonsei University

detail.title: One Size Does Not Fit All: Unveiling Asymmetric Transmission of Monetary Policy in the Euro Area
detail.abstract: Despite extensive research, there is little consensus on whether common monetary policy generates systematically asymmetric effects within the euro area. We argue that this ambiguity arises from failing to account for heterogeneity in local cyclical conditions at the time of policy changes, which leads state-dependent responses to obscure underlying cross-country differences. To address this, we construct a measure of country-specific monetary policy that internalizes local cyclical conditions. This adjustment reveals systematic asymmetries in policy transmission between core and periphery euro area countries that conventional methods overlook. We find that macroeconomic and financial variables respond more strongly in periphery countries. In contrast, credit and housing booms are largely absent in core countries. This differential response is consistent with the bank lending channel of monetary policy: banks in periphery countries ease mortgage lending standards following an expansionary shock, while those in core countries tighten them. Cross-border banking flow patterns further corroborate the importance of credit supply in explaining regional heterogeneity.

AI.tldr: 本文通过考虑欧元区国家在货币政策变化时的本地周期性条件异质性，揭示了核心与外围国家在政策传导中的系统性不对称性。研究发现，外围国家的宏观经济和金融变量反应更强，而核心国家则较少出现信贷和房地产繁荣。

title: Innovation Under Suppression: Censorship's Effect on Cultural Production in Early-Modern England
affiliations: University of Maryland - Department of Economics and Washington and Lee University - Department of Economics

detail.title: Innovation Under Suppression: Censorship's Effect on Cultural Production in Early-Modern England
detail.abstract: We use a panel-data framework to study the effects of print censorship on early-modern England's cultural production. Doing so requires distilling dispersed qualitative information into quantitative data. Integrating the historical record implicit in a large language model (LLM) with facts from secondary sources, we generate an annual index of print censorship. Applying a machine-learning (ML) algorithm to a major corpus, we construct document-level measures of the innovativeness (quality) and volume (quantity) of cultural production. We use pre-existing topic-model estimates to apportion each document among distinct cultural themes-three affected by censorship and five unaffected. We thereby assemble a yearly theme-level panel for 1525-1700. We use local projections to estimate censorship's dynamic effects. Paradoxically, censorship raises the level of innovativeness in censorship-affected themes relative to non-affected themes. Censorship has a temporary chilling effect on the quantity of cultural production, with output recovering within a decade. Our findings are robust to the use of an instrumental-variable approach addressing the endogeneity of censorship. Our findings are unchanged when using three alternative LLMs to produce the censorship index. Using LLMs and ML to measure hard-to-quantify phenomena like censorship and cultural production, we provide new insights into the drivers of cultural evolution.

title: Governance Through Delay and Disclosure: Market and Insider Response to SEC Trading Reforms
affiliations: Boston University - Questrom School of Business, University of Arkansas, Fayetteville - Department of Accounting, INSEAD, University of Cambridge Judge Business School and University of Arkansas, Fayetteville - Department of Accounting

detail.title: Governance Through Delay and Disclosure: Market and Insider Response to SEC Trading Reforms
detail.abstract: We examine how capital markets and corporate insiders respond to the SEC's 2022 amendments to Rule 10b5-1, which governs pre-scheduled insider trading plans. Prompted by concerns that insiders exploited plans to trade on nonpublic information, the reforms introduced enhanced disclosure and restrictions on plan adoption and execution. We find that markets react positively to the rule's adoption, especially for firms whose officers and directors sold frequently or profitably under 10b5-1. The response is stronger for firms whose insiders exhibit 10b5-1 trading behaviors targeted by the rule-such as short cooling-off periods or trades shortly before earnings announcements-and becomes especially pronounced in response to the SEC's first 10b5-1 enforcement action. We observe a sharp decline in 10b5-1 trading volume and profitability, and changes in firm-level insider trading policy following amendment proposal and implementation. Overall, the findings suggest that targeted regulation and enforcement can deter opportunistic trading and enhance shareholder value.

AI.tldr: 研究探讨了资本市场和公司内部人士对SEC 2022年修订的Rule 10b5-1的反应，该规则规范了预定的内幕交易计划。改革旨在防止内幕人士利用非公开信息交易，市场对规则采纳反应积极，尤其是那些高管频繁或盈利交易的公司。10b5-1交易量和盈利性显著下降，表明针对性监管能遏制机会主义交易并提升股东价值。

title: A unifying microeconomic analysis of crime concentration: observation, theory, and experiment
affiliations: Thompson Rivers University - School of Business and Economics, Utah State University - Department of Economics and Finance and University of Michigan at Dearborn

detail.title: A unifying microeconomic analysis of crime concentration: observation, theory, and experiment
detail.abstract: What causes crime to concentrate in a small set of locations? To answer this question, we employ a three-stage methodological approach that moves from observation to theory to experimental validation. We first revisit the micro details of the 1967 riots in Detroit, a major motivator for grievance theories prominent in sociology and psychology, and identify key empirical patterns in the spatial distribution of crime. Based on these observed patterns, we develop an economic model where civilians choose where to commit crimes while officers choose where to patrol, generating testable predictions about the conditions under which crime concentrates. Finally, we conduct a laboratory experiment that tests these theoretical predictions in a controlled environment. Our unified approach exploits methodological comparative advantages in explaining historical patterns and predicting behavior in new settings.

AI.tldr: 本文通过三阶段方法（观察、理论建模、实验验证）研究犯罪为何集中在少数地点，结合历史案例（1967年底特律骚乱）与经济模型，并通过实验室实验验证理论预测。

detail.abstract: The Islamic intellectual tradition once led the world in science, mathematics, and discovery. But today, much of that legacy lies dormant-not for lack of brilliance, but for lack of systematic nurturing. This research paper introduces the draft course "Quranic Tafakkur Conditioning Course: Training the Mind for Scientific Thinking," the first known curriculum of its kind that directly combines Quranic reflection with structured scientific research methodology. Designed to awaken the latent researcher within every believer, this course trains participants to extract scientific questions from Qur'anic verses using tadabbur (deep reflection) and tafaqqur (structured contemplation)-then pursue answers using scientific methods, ethical inquiry, and Quranic alignment. The approach is both deeply traditional and radically forward-thinking, calling for a revival of critical thinking rooted in divine revelation. This paper serves as the timestamped publication of the draft syllabus and philosophical foundation of the course. It includes the complete draft curriculum, spiritual research conduct, case studies, research tools, and publishing guidance-with a call to action for institutions, educators, and scholars to adopt and evolve this model worldwide. Any use, reproduction, or modification of this concept requires written permission. OSF/SSRN timestamp confirms the originality and priority of this intellectual property.

title: Geometric ergodicity and mixing of a class of multivariate GARCH models with regime-switching innovations
affiliations: Chair of Econometrics, University of Göttingen (Gottingen) and University of Göttingen

detail.title: Geometric ergodicity and mixing of a class of multivariate GARCH models with regime-switching innovations
detail.abstract: This short article establishes geometric ergodicity and mixing properties for a general VEC multivariate GARCH model with regime-switching innovations. Unlike regime-switching parameter models, the law of the returns still depends on the regime variable even after conditioning on the covariance matrix $H_t$. Nevertheless, a properly defined joint Markov process has the block-triangular structure, so that the geometric ergodicity of the sub-process extends to the joint process. We also allow for a non-symmetric square-root $H_t^{1/2}$.

AI.tldr: 本文为具有状态转换创新的广义VEC多元GARCH模型建立了几何遍历性和混合性质。与状态转换参数模型不同，即使在条件化协方差矩阵$H_t$后，收益的规律仍依赖于状态变量。然而，通过定义联合马尔可夫过程的块三角结构，子过程的几何遍历性可扩展到联合过程。此外，模型允许非对称平方根$H_t^{1/2}$。
AI.research_question: 如何为具有状态转换创新的广义VEC多元GARCH模型建立几何遍历性和混合性质？
AI.motivation: 现有研究未充分探讨状态转换创新对GARCH模型动态性质的影响，特别是几何遍历性和混合性质。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于VEC多元GARCH模型和马尔可夫过程理论，结合状态转换创新。
AI.method: 定义联合马尔可夫过程的块三角结构，扩展子过程的几何遍历性到联合过程。
AI.findings: 证明了广义VEC多元GARCH模型的几何遍历性和混合性质，允许非对称平方根$H_t^{1/2}$。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了GARCH模型的理论框架，特别是状态转换创新对动态性质的影响。
AI.practical_contributions: 为金融时间序列建模提供了更灵活的工具，适用于非对称波动性分析。

title: AM-CPU: Adaptive Modular RISC-V CPU Architecture with Hybrid Cores and AI-Optimized Extensions
affiliations: National Institute of Technology

detail.title: AM-CPU: Adaptive Modular RISC-V CPU Architecture with Hybrid Cores and AI-Optimized Extensions
detail.abstract: The Adaptive Modular CPU (AM-CPU) is a novel RISC-V based processor architecture that bridges the gap between general-purpose CPUs and AI accelerators for edge and general computing. It features a heterogeneous core design (high-performance and efficiency cores on one chip) combined with RISC-V Vector (RVV 1.0) SIMD capabilities and custom fused instructions tailored for AI workloads. By integrating a big out-of-order core and a little in-order core with dynamic voltage-frequency scaling, AM-CPU can adapt to varying performance and power requirements. New instructions, such as fused load+multiply-accumulate and a single-instruction convolution engine, reduce instruction counts and memory traffic in convolutional neural network (CNN) computations. Preliminary simulations of deep learning tasks demonstrate up to 2-5× speedups and 10-30% fewer instructions executed, while maintaining the flexibility of a generalpurpose CPU. This document serves as both a research paper and a provisional patent disclosure, detailing the background, architecture, implementation, and advantages of the AM-CPU, with notes on ongoing validation steps.

AI.tldr: AM-CPU是一种基于RISC-V的新型处理器架构，通过异构核心设计和定制指令集，在边缘计算和通用计算中实现高性能与低功耗的平衡。
AI.research_question: 如何设计一种既能满足通用计算需求又能高效处理AI工作负载的处理器架构？
AI.motivation: 填补通用CPU与AI加速器之间的性能与灵活性鸿沟，适应边缘计算的需求。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于RISC-V指令集，结合异构核心设计（高性能与高效能核心）和RISC-V Vector (RVV 1.0) SIMD能力。
AI.method: 采用动态电压频率调节技术，设计定制指令（如融合加载+乘积累加指令）以减少指令数和内存流量。
AI.findings: 初步模拟显示，深度学习任务速度提升2-5倍，指令数减少10-30%，同时保持通用CPU的灵活性。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一种结合通用计算与AI加速的处理器架构设计方法。
AI.practical_contributions: 为边缘计算和AI应用提供了一种高性能、低功耗的处理器解决方案。

title: A Post-COVID Macroprudential Framework for Climate Risk Stress Testing in the Banking Sector
affiliations: The University of Lahore Islamabad Campus

detail.title: A Post-COVID Macroprudential Framework for Climate Risk Stress Testing in the Banking Sector

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The authors declare that they have no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This research did not involve human patients or clinical trials. However, ethical standards were upheld throughout the study. Data collection was conducted through professional surveys and publicly available secondary data sources, without any personally identifiable or confidential financial information being disclosed. All respondents participating in the survey were informed of the research purpose, and their participation was entirely voluntary. Written informed consent was obtained from all participants prior to their involvement in the study. The research protocol adhered to institutional guidelines on ethical research practices and data privacy.

detail.abstract:
The COVID-19 pandemic has revealed critical vulnerabilities in the global financial system, prompting the need for a more resilient macroprudential architecture. Concurrently, climate change continues to pose systemic risks that are complex, long-term, and uncertain. This study develops a comprehensive post-COVID macroprudential framework for climate risk stress testing (CRST) in the banking sector, integrating real data from 2019 to 2025 across major European and American banks. By incorporating pandemic-induced shocks and climate transition pathways, the framework simulates dual-risk scenarios to assess bank-level solvency, credit losses, and systemic contagion.

The proposed framework utilizes a multi-model approach, combining NGFS climate scenarios, System-GMM, Panel VAR, Credit Portfolio Models (CPM), Climate Value-at-Risk (VaR), DSGE simulation, and Network Contagion Models. Empirical results show that banks with higher carbon exposure and weaker pre-COVID capital buffers experienced amplified losses under compounded stress events. Furthermore, network-based contagion effects reveal significant cross-border vulnerabilities, especially within the European interbank market.

The findings underscore the importance of integrating pandemic risks into climate stress testing and call for enhanced macroprudential tools such as climate-specific capital buffers, ESG-aligned disclosure requirements, and countercyclical regulatory interventions. This paper contributes to the growing body of climate-finance literature by offering a practical, data-driven framework to guide policymakers, regulators, and financial institutions in strengthening systemic resilience amid converging global crises.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种综合性的后疫情时代宏观审慎框架，用于银行业的气候风险压力测试（CRST），结合了2019至2025年的实际数据，评估了双重风险情景下的银行偿付能力、信用损失和系统性传染。
AI.research_question: 如何在后疫情时代构建一个能够同时应对疫情和气候变化的宏观审慎框架，以增强银行业的系统性韧性？
AI.motivation: COVID-19疫情和气候变化揭示了全球金融体系的脆弱性，亟需一种更全面的风险管理框架。
AI.theoretical_framework: 结合NGFS气候情景、System-GMM、Panel VAR、信用组合模型（CPM）、气候风险价值（VaR）、DSGE模拟和网络传染模型。
AI.method: 采用多模型方法，模拟双重风险情景，分析银行层面的偿付能力、信用损失和系统性传染。
AI.findings: 碳暴露较高且疫情前资本缓冲较弱的银行在复合压力事件下损失更大；欧洲银行间市场存在显著的跨境脆弱性。
AI.theory_contributions: 为气候金融文献提供了数据驱动的框架，扩展了宏观审慎政策的理论边界。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者、监管机构和金融机构提供了增强系统性韧性的实用工具，如气候特定资本缓冲和ESG披露要求。

title: Gun Range Immunity: An Argument Against Legalized Nuisance and Non-Governmental Takings
affiliations: St. Mary's University - School of Law

detail.title: Gun Range Immunity: An Argument Against Legalized Nuisance and Non-Governmental Takings
detail.abstract:
People exhausted by the increasingly fast-paced life and loud noises of the big city will often seek refuge in the solitude of quiet country living. Perhaps naïve, the romantic thought of waking to the scenic views of an early morning sunrise burning an orange hue across the pasture or the sweet sounds of a Bachman’s sparrow singing from the birdhouse placed neatly within view of the kitchen window is abruptly squashed when rural landowners fall victim to the excessively loud sport of outdoor firearm shooting.

Protecting rural landowners’ rights to the quiet use and enjoyment of their property has been a bedrock of American jurisprudence for more than two hundred years. State legislatures, however, saw fit to erode this once revered protection by seemingly favoring the advancement of corporate enterprise and urban growth through the passage of immunity laws that provide gun range owners with legal protection against noise abatement claims, thereby leaving landowners desperate for relief from the unwavering sounds of war that such gun ranges produce. Viewed positively, immunity statutes make excessive noise from a gun range a legalized nuisance. Viewed critically, immunity statutes result in the state sponsoring of non-governmental actors freely wielding unconstitutional private takings against rural landowners.

This Article discusses issues faced by rural landowners, described herein as “disregarded victims,” who were living in their homes or operating a business prior to a gun range establishing a nearby operation. This Article specifically argues for legislative reform to curtail the immunity so generously afforded to gun range operators and to provide a justiciable pathway for existing rural landowners to seek noise abatement relief through private claims.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了农村土地所有者因附近射击场噪音而面临的问题，呼吁立法改革以限制射击场的法律豁免权，并为土地所有者提供寻求噪音缓解的途径。
AI.research_question: 如何通过立法改革保护农村土地所有者免受射击场噪音侵害？
AI.motivation: 农村土地所有者因射击场噪音而无法享受宁静生活，现有法律豁免权使问题加剧，亟需改革。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于美国法律中对土地所有者权利的保护传统，分析现行豁免法律的缺陷。
AI.method: 通过法律文献分析和案例研究，探讨立法改革的必要性。
AI.findings: 现行豁免法律导致射击场噪音成为合法化的公害，损害了土地所有者的权利。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了豁免法律对私人财产权的潜在威胁，提出了法律改革的框架。
AI.practical_contributions: 为立法者提供了改革建议，以平衡企业利益与土地所有者权利。

title: Seeing beyond stars: Efficient learning when ratings mix price and quality
affiliations: Institute of Economics, Academia Sinica

detail.title: Seeing beyond stars: Efficient learning when ratings mix price and quality
detail.abstract: Online ratings influence consumer decisions by summarizing multiple product attributes, such as quality and price, into a single numerical score. Although useful and informative, aggregating multiple dimensions into a single measure complicates consumers' inference of true product quality, particularly when sellers adjust prices strategically and detailed historical data are unavailable. This paper examines whether social learning, in which consumers accurately infer product quality from ratings, remains feasible under these challenges. We demonstrate that social learning is indeed achievable: even if sellers fully extract consumer surplus, pushing ratings toward neutrality, subtle signals persist, allowing consumers to infer true quality using only the current rating. However, we find that strategic pricing by sellers creates recency bias, significantly reducing learning efficiency. To address this, we propose a simple yet optimal weighted-average rating mechanism. This mechanism relies solely on current data but achieves efficient social learning comparable to a full-history benchmark, highlighting that effective information aggregation can substitute for detailed historical disclosure.

AI.tldr: 论文探讨了在线评分如何影响消费者决策，尤其是在卖家策略性定价和缺乏详细历史数据的情况下，消费者是否仍能通过评分准确推断产品质量。研究发现，尽管卖家行为可能导致评分趋于中性，但消费者仍能从当前评分中推断出真实质量。然而，策略性定价会引发近因偏差，降低学习效率。为此，作者提出了一种简单而最优的加权平均评分机制，仅依赖当前数据即可实现高效的社会学习。
AI.research_question: 在卖家策略性定价和缺乏详细历史数据的情况下，消费者是否仍能通过在线评分准确推断产品质量？
AI.motivation: 在线评分将多维度产品属性（如质量和价格）汇总为单一数值，虽便于消费者决策，但也可能因信息简化而影响对真实质量的推断。研究旨在探讨在这种复杂情境下，社会学习是否仍可行。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于社会学习理论和信息聚合理论，研究探讨了消费者如何从评分中推断产品质量，以及卖家策略性定价对学习效率的影响。
AI.method: 通过理论建模和实证分析，研究了消费者对评分的解读方式，并提出了加权平均评分机制。
AI.findings: 研究发现，尽管卖家行为可能导致评分趋于中性，但消费者仍能从当前评分中推断出真实质量。然而，策略性定价会引发近因偏差，降低学习效率。
AI.theory_contributions: 研究丰富了社会学习理论，揭示了在信息简化情境下消费者仍能实现有效学习的机制。
AI.practical_contributions: 提出的加权平均评分机制为平台设计提供了实用工具，可在不依赖历史数据的情况下提升消费者决策效率。

title: The Proliferation of Unilateral Trade Measures and the Crisis of the Multilateral Trading System
affiliations: Zhejiang University and NingboTech University - School of Law

detail.title: The Proliferation of Unilateral Trade Measures and the Crisis of the Multilateral Trading System

publicationDetails.detailsText: Journal of International Dispute Settlement 2025, Volume 16, No. 3 (forthcoming)

detail.abstract: Following President Trump's assumption of office at the start of the year, he introduced a series of tariff measures. These unilateral trade actions, especially the reciprocal tariffs, could have profound and far-reaching consequences, potentially undermining the very foundations of the multilateral trading system. This is due to their direct challenge to the Most-Favored-Nation (MFN) principle, a cornerstone of the World Trade Organization (WTO). Additionally, the unilateral trade measures imposed by the United States have triggered follow-up actions from other nations, resulting in reciprocal countermeasures. It is critical to determine how to respond to reciprocal tariffs in a manner that preserves the integrity of the multilateral trading system. Special attention must be given to the creation of a complex network of bilateral agreements, formed through bilateral consultations after the implementation of US reciprocal tariffs, which may indirectly weaken the multilateral framework.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨特朗普总统上任后实施的关税措施及其对多边贸易体系的潜在影响，重点关注其对WTO最惠国原则的挑战以及引发的各国反制措施。

title: Health Economics and Vaccine Financing in the Eastern Mediterranean Region: A Needs Assessment, February 2025
affiliations: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine, affiliation not provided to SSRN, affiliation not provided to SSRN, affiliation not provided to SSRN, World Health Organization, Department of Immunization, Vaccines and Biologicals, World Health Organization, affiliation not provided to SSRN, affiliation not provided to SSRN, World Health Organization (WHO) - Department of Immunization, Vaccines and Biologicals (IVB), Immunization, Vaccines and Biologicals (IVB) Department, World Health Organization (WHO) and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: Health Economics and Vaccine Financing in the Eastern Mediterranean Region: A Needs Assessment, February 2025
detail.abstract: Introduction The Eastern Mediterranean Region (EMR) faces a high burden of vaccine-preventable diseases requiring efficient use of limited resources. A regional needs assessment was conducted to evaluate the current application of health economics in immunization programmes, identify capacity gaps, and inform tailored technical support.MethodsA structured online survey was administered between January 28 and February 18, 2025. It targeted National immunization programme managers and National Immunization Technical Advisory Group chairs across all 22 EMR countries. The questionnaire explored five thematic areas: current capacity in health economics and vaccine financing, training and capacity-building needs,  demand for technical and analytical support, data availability and use in decision-making, and strategic planning for vaccine financing. The survey used multiple-choice, Likert-scale, and open-ended questions. Results were analyzed using descriptive statistics and disaggregated by in-come level.ResultsThe response rate was 73% (16 / 22 countries). Only three countries (19%) reported full integration of health economics into immunization programmes, while nine (56%) reported minimal or no integration. Three countries had a dedicated health economics focal person for immunization. Two HICs demonstrated stronger capacity in health economics, whereas the rest of countries demonstrated low to moderate levels. Ten countries (63%) rated their capacity in financial forecasting and planning for immunization as moderate or high, but eleven (69%) rated their capacity in cost-effectiveness analysis and vaccine financial sustainability as low to none. Access to data varied, with 25% finding it easily accessible. Nine countries (56%) relied mainly on domestic government funds for vaccine procurement, but only six (38%) for immunization operations, with three LICs still reliant on external donor support.ConclusionThe findings highlight a need to strengthen the integration of health economics into immunization programmes across the EMR, regardless of income level. Tailored capacity-building, technical support, and cross-sectoral collaboration, particularly with academia, are essential.

AI.tldr: 东地中海地区（EMR）疫苗可预防疾病负担高，需高效利用有限资源。区域需求评估显示，健康经济学在免疫规划中的应用不足，需加强能力建设和技术支持。
AI.research_question: 东地中海地区如何将健康经济学有效整合到免疫规划中？
